episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and historical facts, including a cowboy's first car experience, historical legal obligations to stop thieves, a massive helium discovery, and a humorous Wikipedia edit involving Dan Schreiber.

facts.fact: When Dick Loss, the president of the Montana Cowboy Association, drove a car for the first time, he crashed it into a fence because instead of using the brake pedal, he pulled back on the steering wheel and yelled, 'whoa!'
Until the 19th century, if someone shouted, 'stop thief,' you had no choice but to try and stop the thief.
In 2016, scientists found a pocket of helium so big that it could make everyone on the planet sound squeaky for 20 minutes.
If you look up humour on Wikipedia, the first thing you'll see is a picture of my face.
